Term: 2019 Spring

Class: COMPSCI   152 

Section: 001

 

Reason: Time conflict with another section.

 

As neither class allows time conflict enrollments, you will remain on the waitlist unless or until you resolve the time conflict.

 

Actions you can take:

  • Drop the class that has a time conflict with the one above.

  • Select a different section of either class to resolve the time conflict.

  • If you want only the above class: Request a swap with the time-conflicted class.  This requires relinquishing your position on the waitlist

Which means, if you DO make it into the class, you won't be able to drop if you don't like it.
How likely is 162 going to expand? And how likely is it for people to drop the class.

The general rule of thumb is that appx 10% of enrolled students will drop the class. So, look at the max capacity for the class & determine what 10% of that number is - if you fall within that range, you stand a good chance of getting in but keep in mind that there are no guarantees and you should always have a backup plan.

history.content:
[Updated 1/28/18]

This is the master list of announcements for SP19 upper div CS classes.  General enrollment information is at the end of this post.

 

  • CS C100/C200A – 1/24 Class JUST expanded to 920 for CS 100 and 60 for CS 200A. Enroll into lecture and 999 section. Pre-reqs NOT being enforced via CalCentral this semester. Class being webcast.

  • CS 152/252 – Class fully enrolled at 65 seats with a short wait list. No plans to expand the course. Enroll into lecture and actual section.

  • CS 160/260A – This class is fully enrolled with a long wait list. I just heard from instructor that this class will NOT expand again.

  • CS 161 – This class recently expanded and has open seats. Enroll into lecture and 999 section.

  • CS 162 - This class is fully enrolled with a short wait list. This class will not expand beyond 408 seats. Enroll into lecture and 999 section. This is an EARLY DROP DEADLINE class.

  • CS 164 – This class has open seats. Enroll into lecture and 999 section. 

  • CS 169 – This class is fully enrolled and will not expand past 120 seats. Class works in teams. Enroll into the lecture and 999 section. Read the class page to learn about how teams will be formed. This is an EARLY DROP DEADLINE class. Time conflicts are not allowed for this class and it will not be webcast.

  • CS 170 – Class being webcast - 1/23 update - I JUST got a request to expand this class to 880 seats but it may take 2 days to make it happen in the system. If you're on the wait list, stay put! Enroll into the lecture and 999 section. Time conflicts are not allowed for this class! Even if system allows you to enroll in time conflicted class - faculty will NOT make accommodations for the conflict.

  • CS 172 – 1/28 update: This class JUST expanded to the room capacity of 98. A new lab section has been added as well to accommodate increased enrollment. This class is being taught by a visiting instructor - not identified yet. Guest instructor hasn’t formally been hired yet. Class is fully enrolled at 70 students.

  • CS 174 – This class has open seats. Enroll into lecture and section.

  • CS 182/282A – Enroll into the lecture and 999 section. Class webcast but not likely to expand past room capacity.

  • CS 182/282A - Class is fully enrolled with a significant wait list. CS 182 MIGHT expand to 200 seats but no further. CS 282A will not expand again.


  • CS 184/284A - 1/24 - This class has just expanded to 350 seats for CS 184 and 50 seats for CS 284A.

  • CS W186 - This class is fully enrolled. No further expansion planned. Lecture is web-based only for this class but in-person discussion sections and office-hours will be held. 

  • CS 188 – 1/28 update: Over the weekend, the profs decided to increase enrollment and clear the wait list. That has now been done. If you've dropped and are interested in taking the class, check again - there are a few seats open with no wait list.  Enroll into the lecture and the 999 section.

  • CS 189/289A – This class is fully enrolled with a long wait list. It will NOT expand past 744 seats total. Class will be webcast but enrollment won’t expand past room capacity. Pre-reqs won’t be enforced in SP19 - they were only used in F18 to solve over-enrollment problem which won’t happen in SP19.

  • CS C191 – Enroll via CHEM C191 or PHYSICS C191.

  • CS 194-031 – This class just expanded to 45 seats and will not expand further.

  • CS 195 – Class expanded to 408 and will not expand again. Enroll into the lecture.

 

 

The remainder of this post contains general enrollment information.

 

  1. To see who can enroll into CS upper div classes and when, read: https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy#upper


  2. Time Conflicts - The enrollment system WILL ALLOW time conflicts between CompSci classes and other classes. However, even though CalCentral will allow enrollment into both classes, it is still the student’s responsibility to plan their schedule carefully. Departments and faculty are NOT required or expected to accommodate students’ schedule conflicts, and the Instructor of Record may decline to enroll or Instructor Drop a student from a class if they cannot be present for all schedule activities, including midterms and finals.

    Best practice is to check attendance policies for each class and to speak to the instructors before enrolling in time conflicted classes.

  3. Waitlist Processing:

  • We will NOT purge the waitlist of non-CS/EECS majors at the end of phase 1 this semester.

  • During the Adjustment Period, wait lists are automatically processed in numerical order based on the waitlist position. A student’s major is NOT taken into consideration when the wait list is processed. During Phases 1 and 2, students who meet reserve requirements for a class will be enrolled from the wait list if there are open seats, even before students with a better wait list position who do not meet reserve requirements.

  • If enrolling the student into the class will put them over the maximum number of units, the system will also skip the student when processing the wait list. Units for wait listed classes count towards the upper unit limit: 13.5 phase 1, 17.5 phase 2, and 20 units over all.

  • Waitlisted students who have time conflicts will no longer be held on the waitlist and will now be processed in sequential order like any other student. (As in the past, not meeting a reserve cap or exceeding the unit limit will still prevent students from being enrolled from the wait list.)

    Students on the waitlist for a class are NOT guaranteed to get into the class and should make a reasonable back-up plan.

  1. 70% Rule - When hiring is uncertain for discussion section GSI/TA staff, we hold back 30% of seats as code 55 or ‘permission required’. Once we know what the hiring will be for a class, we release these seats back to regular enrollment process

  2. 999 sections will be used for many but not all upper div classes. These are faux sections that allow students to enroll in the lecture and the 999 section(s) only via Cal Central. 

    Since students no longer drop/re-enroll when they want to switch sections, they will no longer risk being bumped to the end of the waitlist when they need to make a change. Additionally, the 999 section has no scheduled day or time which reduces the number of time conflicts that must be processed online. It DOES mean that students need to be patient and wait until class starts to know which section they will actually attend.

    Students can still see the actual section days/times via classes.berkeley.edu


          Assignments to actual sections will be handled outside of Cal Central by faculty either:

  • During first lecture

  • Via communication from instructor to use alternate form (e.g. Google form or SignMeUp!)

  • Via course home page

This is the master list of announcements for SP19 upper div CS classes.  General enrollment information is at the end of this post.

  • CS 152/252 – Class fully enrolled at 65 seats with a short wait list. No plans to expand the course. Enroll into lecture and actual section.

  • CS 160/260A – This class is fully enrolled with a long wait list. I just heard from instructor that this class will NOT expand again.

  • CS 161 – This class recently expanded and has open seats. Enroll into lecture and 999 section.

  • CS 162 - This class is fully enrolled with a short wait list. This class will not expand beyond 408 seats. Enroll into lecture and 999 section. This is an EARLY DROP DEADLINE class.

  • CS 164 – This class has open seats. Enroll into lecture and 999 section. 

  • CS 169 – This class is fully enrolled and will not expand past 120 seats. Class works in teams. Enroll into the lecture and 999 section. Read the class page to learn about how teams will be formed. This is an EARLY DROP DEADLINE class. Time conflicts are not allowed for this class and it will not be webcast.

  • CS 170 – Class being webcast - 1/23 update - I JUST got a request to expand this class to 880 seats but it may take 2 days to make it happen in the system. If you're on the wait list, stay put! Enroll into the lecture and 999 section. Time conflicts are not allowed for this class! Even if system allows you to enroll in time conflicted class - faculty will NOT make accommodations for the conflict.

  • CS 172 – This class is being taught by a visiting instructor - not identified yet. Guest instructor hasn’t formally been hired yet. Class is fully enrolled at 70 students.

  • CS 174 – This class has open seats. Enroll into lecture and section.

  • CS 182/282A – Enroll into the lecture and 999 section. Class webcast but not likely to expand past room capacity.

  • CS 182/282A - Class is fully enrolled with a significant wait list. CS 182 MIGHT expand to 200 seats but no further. CS 282A will not expand again.


  • CS 184/284A - 1/24 - This class has just expanded to 350 seats for CS 184 and 50 seats for CS 284A.

  • CS W186 - This class is fully enrolled. No further expansion planned. Lecture is web-based only for this class but in-person discussion sections and office-hours will be held. 

  • CS 188 – 1/24 - Sorry everyone, turns out this class will NOT expand further. Enroll into the lecture and the 999 section.

  • CS 189/289A – This class is fully enrolled with a long wait list. It will NOT expand past 744 seats total. Class will be webcast but enrollment won’t expand past room capacity. Pre-reqs won’t be enforced in SP19 - they were only used in F18 to solve over-enrollment problem which won’t happen in SP19.

  • CS C191 – Enroll via CHEM C191 or PHYSICS C191.

  • CS 194-031 – This class just expanded to 45 seats and will not expand further.

  • CS 195 – Class expanded to 408 and will not expand again. Enroll into the lecture.

 

 

The remainder of this post contains general enrollment information.

 

  1. To see who can enroll into CS upper div classes and when, read: https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy#upper


  2. Time Conflicts - The enrollment system WILL ALLOW time conflicts between CompSci classes and other classes. However, even though CalCentral will allow enrollment into both classes, it is still the student’s responsibility to plan their schedule carefully. Departments and faculty are NOT required or expected to accommodate students’ schedule conflicts, and the Instructor of Record may decline to enroll or Instructor Drop a student from a class if they cannot be present for all schedule activities, including midterms and finals.

    Best practice is to check attendance policies for each class and to speak to the instructors before enrolling in time conflicted classes.

  3. Waitlist Processing:

  • We will NOT purge the waitlist of non-CS/EECS majors at the end of phase 1 this semester.

  • During the Adjustment Period, wait lists are automatically processed in numerical order based on the waitlist position. A student’s major is NOT taken into consideration when the wait list is processed. During Phases 1 and 2, students who meet reserve requirements for a class will be enrolled from the wait list if there are open seats, even before students with a better wait list position who do not meet reserve requirements.

  • If enrolling the student into the class will put them over the maximum number of units, the system will also skip the student when processing the wait list. Units for wait listed classes count towards the upper unit limit: 13.5 phase 1, 17.5 phase 2, and 20 units over all.

  • Waitlisted students who have time conflicts will no longer be held on the waitlist and will now be processed in sequential order like any other student. (As in the past, not meeting a reserve cap or exceeding the unit limit will still prevent students from being enrolled from the wait list.)

    Students on the waitlist for a class are NOT guaranteed to get into the class and should make a reasonable back-up plan.

  1. 70% Rule - When hiring is uncertain for discussion section GSI/TA staff, we hold back 30% of seats as code 55 or ‘permission required’. Once we know what the hiring will be for a class, we release these seats back to regular enrollment process

  2. 999 sections will be used for many but not all upper div classes. These are faux sections that allow students to enroll in the lecture and the 999 section(s) only via Cal Central. 

    Since students no longer drop/re-enroll when they want to switch sections, they will no longer risk being bumped to the end of the waitlist when they need to make a change. Additionally, the 999 section has no scheduled day or time which reduces the number of time conflicts that must be processed online. It DOES mean that students need to be patient and wait until class starts to know which section they will actually attend.

    Students can still see the actual section days/times via classes.berkeley.edu


          Assignments to actual sections will be handled outside of Cal Central by faculty either:

  • During first lecture

  • Via communication from instructor to use alternate form (e.g. Google form or SignMeUp!)

  • Via course home page

    Since students no longer drop/re-enroll when they want to switch sections, they will no longer risk being bumped to the end of the waitlist when they need to make a change. Additionally, the 999 section has no scheduled day or time which reduces the number of time conflicts that must be processed online. It DOES mean that students need to be patient and wait until class starts to know which section they will actually attend.

    Students can still see the actual section days/times via classes.berkeley.edu

  • During first lecture

  • Via communication from instructor to use alternate form (e.g. Google form or SignMeUp!)

  • Via course home page

history.content:
This is the master list of announcements for SP19 upper div CS classes.  General enrollment information is at the end of this post.

 

  • CS C100/C200A – Enroll into lecture and 999 section. Pre-reqs NOT being enforced via CalCentral this semester.

  • CS 152/252 – Enroll into lecture and actual section.

  • CS 160/260A – Enroll into lecture and 999 section.

  • CS 161 – Enroll into lecture and 999 section.

  • CS 162 - Enroll into lecture and 999 section. This is an EARLY DROP DEADLINE class.

  • CS 164 – Enroll into lecture and 999 section. Enrollment capped at 70% until GSI/TA hiring is completed - this will show up in system as seats that require permission codes. As soon as hiring process has been completed, we will release these seats.

  • CS 169 – Wait list for the lecture and 999 section - NO ONE can enroll in the class directly. There is still no information from Prof Fox about how teams will be formed in SP19. This is an EARLY DROP DEADLINE class.

  • CS 170 – Once we receive approval to exceed room capacity, the class will expand and will be webcast. Enroll into the lecture and 999 section. Time conflicts are not allowed for this class! Even if system allows you to enroll in time conflicted class - faculty will NOT make accommodations for the conflict.

  • CS 172 – This class is being taught by a visiting instructor - not identified yet. Enrollment is BLOCKED until the visiting instructor is hired.

  • CS 174 – Enroll into lecture and section.

  • CS 182/282A – Enroll into the lecture and 999 section. Class webcast but not likely to expand past room capacity.

  • CS 184/284A - Once we receive approval to exceed room capacity, the class will expand and will be webcast. Enroll into the lecture and 999 section. Enrollment capped at 70% until GSI/TA hiring is completed - this will show up in system as seats that require permission codes. As soon as hiring process has been completed, we will release these seats.

  • CS W186 - Lecture is web-based only for this class but in-person discussion sections and office-hours will be held. Class will be taught by visiting instructor - not identified yet.

  • CS 188 – Enroll into the lecture and the 999 section. Enrollment capped at 70% until GSI/TA hiring is completed - this will show up in system as seats that require permission codes. As soon as hiring process has been completed, we will release these seats.

  • CS 189/289A – Enroll into the lecture and 999 section. Class will be webcast but enrollment won’t expand past room capacity. Pre-reqs won’t be enforced in SP19 - they were only used in F18 to solve over-enrollment problem which won’t happen in SP19.

  • CS C191 – Although it appears on the class listing, this class isn’t available for enrollment until we know who is teaching the class. Keep checking Piazza and classes.berkeley.edu for more information.

  • CS 194-034 – Enroll into lecture.

  • CS 195 – Enroll into the lecture.

 

 

The remainder of this post contains general enrollment information.

 

  1. To see who can enroll into CS upper div classes and when, read: https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy#upper


  2. Time Conflicts - The enrollment system WILL ALLOW time conflicts between CompSci classes and other classes. However, even though CalCentral will allow enrollment into both classes, it is still the student’s responsibility to plan their schedule carefully. Departments and faculty are NOT required or expected to accommodate students’ schedule conflicts, and the Instructor of Record may decline to enroll or Instructor Drop a student from a class if they cannot be present for all schedule activities, including midterms and finals.

    Best practice is to check attendance policies for each class and to speak to the instructors before enrolling in time conflicted classes.

  3. Waitlist Processing:

  • We will NOT purge the waitlist of non-CS/EECS majors at the end of phase 1 this semester.

  • During the Adjustment Period, wait lists are automatically processed in numerical order based on the waitlist position. A student’s major is NOT taken into consideration when the wait list is processed. During Phases 1 and 2, students who meet reserve requirements for a class will be enrolled from the wait list if there are open seats, even before students with a better wait list position who do not meet reserve requirements.

  • If enrolling the student into the class will put them over the maximum number of units, the system will also skip the student when processing the wait list. Units for wait listed classes count towards the upper unit limit: 13.5 phase 1, 17.5 phase 2, and 20 units over all.

  • Waitlisted students who have time conflicts will no longer be held on the waitlist and will now be processed in sequential order like any other student. (As in the past, not meeting a reserve cap or exceeding the unit limit will still prevent students from being enrolled from the wait list.)

    Students on the waitlist for a class are NOT guaranteed to get into the class and should make a reasonable back-up plan.

  2. 999 sections will be used for many but not all upper div classes. These are faux sections that allow students to enroll in the lecture and the 999 section(s) only via Cal Central.
